sentences.en: I'm starting on a new book .
sentences.cn: 我正开始写一本新书。

sentences.en: A good education gives your child a head start in life.
sentences.cn: 良好的教育会让你的孩子在人生的起跑线上比别人领先一步。

sentences.en: Australia, put in to bat, made a cautious start.
sentences.cn: 轮到澳大利亚队出场击球，他们开始打得很谨慎。

sentences.en: could you face going back to school and starting over?.
sentences.cn: 你能面对返回学校重新开始读书吗。

sentences.en: don't start—I do my fair share.
sentences.cn: 不要发牢骚，我做我应该做的那一份。

sentences.en: Have you started your homework?
sentences.cn: 你开始做家庭作业了吗？

sentences.en: He wanted an early start on his election campaign.
sentences.cn: 他希望早点开始自己的竞选活动。

sentences.en: He was huddled with John trying to jump-start his car.
sentences.cn: 他和约翰凑在一起，试着用跨接引线发动他的汽车。

sentences.en: I can't bring myself to ditch him and start again.
sentences.cn: 我不忍心蹬掉他再觅新欢。

sentences.en: I saw through your little ruse from the start.
sentences.cn: 从一开始我就看穿了你的小计谋。

sentences.en: I’d better get started (= start doing something ) soon.
sentences.cn: 我最好马上就开始。

sentences.en: If you do waken up during the night, start the exercises again.
sentences.cn: 如果你夜里真的醒了，就再从头开始做这套动作。

sentences.en: It's just not enough money to start life over.
sentences.cn: 这些钱根本不够用来开始全新的生活。

sentences.en: people groan when she starts in about her acting ambitions.
sentences.cn: 当她开始表达当演员的志向时，人们报以不满的哼哼声。

sentences.en: She read the letter from start to finish without looking up.
sentences.cn: 她头也不抬地把信从头到尾看完。

sentences.en: she started on about my not having proper furniture.
sentences.cn: 她开始指责我没有合适的家具。

sentences.en: She wanted to start her own catering business.
sentences.cn: 她想自己创立一家餐饮公司。

sentences.en: The boat's engine misfired after he tried to start it up.
sentences.cn: 他试着启动船的引擎，但没发动起来。

sentences.en: The child'll start out by making relatively few distinctions in the language.
sentences.cn: 孩子开始时不太能辨别语言中的差别。

sentences.en: the company will start out with a hundred employees.
sentences.cn: 这个公司开业时将雇用100名员工。

sentences.en: The horse made a winning start for his new trainer.
sentences.cn: 这匹马为它的新驯马师开了个好头。

sentences.en: There has been a busy start to polling in today's local elections.
sentences.cn: 今天地方选举的投票一开始就人头攒动。

sentences.en: There’s so much to do. I don’t know where to start.
sentences.cn: 有那么多的事情要做，我都不知道从哪里开始。

sentences.en: This allowed Ms. Kelley to lay aside money to start her business.
sentences.cn: 这样凯利女士就可以把钱存起来创业。

sentences.en: this side are at an advantage—for a start, there are more of them.
sentences.cn: 这一边处于优势，首先是他们人更多。

sentences.en: Thousands and thousands of start-up firms have poured into the computer market.
sentences.cn: 成千上万家新成立的公司已涌进了计算机市场。

sentences.en: treatment should start off with attention to diet.
sentences.cn: 治疗首先应该从注意饮食开始。

sentences.en: We all start with preconceived notions of what we want from life.
sentences.cn: 我们开始时都对自己想从生活中得到什么抱有一些预想。

sentences.en: We were reluctant to start the long trudge home.
sentences.cn: 我们很不愿意踏上如此漫长艰辛的回家之路。

sentences.en: what started you off on this search?.
sentences.cn: 是什么使你开始这项研究的。

words.tran_cn: 起动机；发令员；第一道菜；发射装置；发起者

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)告诉（某人）不要发牢骚（或指责）
领先；抢先起步的优势；有利的开端
(非正式)开始吵架；开始用言语抨击
着手，开始从事（某事业，尤指商业）
v. 开始；发动；突然站起；突然出现

trans.tran_en: the first part of an activity or event, or the point at which it begins to develop

trans.tran_cn: 开始， 着手； 出发
trans.tran_en: to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it
to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it
to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it

trans.tran_cn: 开始，着手；起身，动身，出发；吃惊，惊起
trans.tran_en: to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it

trans.tran_cn: 开始，着手；发动；使发生，引起；开设，创办
trans.tran_en: to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it
